title: Interpreting the Rate of Expansion

next.title: Testing the Expansion of the Universe from Other Galaxies

content: The steepness of the slope of a Hubble plot corresponds with the rate of expansion of the Universe. A steeper slope indicates a faster rate of expansion. Therefore, a larger value for the Hubble Constant will correspond with a faster expansion rate for the Universe.

question.label: If scientists make observations that establish the Hubble Constant to be 57 (km/s)/Mpc, would that indicate the Universe is expanding faster or slower than your data suggest?
